meanings.definition: Fond of or inclined to drink alcohol.
meanings.sent1: The bibulous man enjoyed a glass of wine with his dinner every evening.
meanings.sent2: She was known among her friends as the most bibulous party-goer.
meanings.sent3: The bibulous bear stumbled around the forest after accidentally drinking fermented berries.
meanings.sent4: The bibulous clouds soaked up the colors of the sunset, turning pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: His bibulous laughter echoed through the room, signaling a night of celebration.

meanings.sent1: The bibulous sponge quickly soaked up the spilled milk on the table.
meanings.sent2: The bibulous paper towel was able to absorb all the water from the wet counter.
meanings.sent3: The bibulous towel saved the day by soaking up the spilled juice before it stained the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The bibulous soil in the garden absorbed the rainwater, keeping the plants hydrated.
meanings.sent5: The bibulous cloth absorbed the ink spill, leaving the desk clean and dry.

meanings.definition: Given to or marked by the consumption of alcohol.
meanings.sent1: The bibulous party guests danced and laughed late into the night.
meanings.sent2: His bibulous behavior at the office party led to some embarrassing moments.
meanings.sent3: The bibulous penguin waddled unsteadily after drinking the spilled martini.
meanings.sent4: The bibulous river flowed with the spirits of the fallen warriors, honoring their memory.
meanings.sent5: The bibulous atmosphere of the pub was filled with the sounds of clinking glasses and merry chatter.
